page.title: 09 THE CARSINGTON RESERVOIR
page.content: The two farms to be submerged and part of the dam are in this block, the rest is in adjoining blocks. Many local people were against the building of the reservoir, and are now worried about its safety since the collapse of the dam. Most feel that it should now be finished since so much disruption has already been caused. The dam will hold back the upper waters of the River Henmore, here called the Scow Brook, which will be augmented by water pumped from the River Derwent at Ambergate in times of plenty. When water is short, it will be pumped back to the Derwent at Ambergate to supplement supply. At the moment investigations are taking place into the cause of the dam collapse, and whether the project should be continued.
